data.title: Best parallel universe / multiverse books
data.meta_description: A parallel universe or alternative reality is a hypothetical self-contained separate reality coexisting with one's own. A spe [...]
data.text:
A parallel universe or alternative reality is a hypothetical self-contained separate reality coexisting with one's own. A specific group of parallel universes is called a multiverse. The fantasy genre has long employed parallel universes and alternate realities with Diana Wynne Jones' Chrestomanci series, Philip Pullman’s His Dark Materials and Stephen King’s Dark Tower series being quality examples. Below you will find book reviews on the three aforementioned series and more.

1. The Gunslinger by Stephen King

The Dark Tower series: Book 1

Score: 199

Our rating: 9.6 | 7 positive reader reviews

In The Gunslinger, Stephen King introduces readers to one of his most enigmatic heroes, Roland of Gilead, the Last Gunslinger. He is a haunting figure, a loner, on a spellbinding journey into good and evil, in a desolate world which frighteningly echoes our own. In his first step towards the powe [...]

Buy on Amazon.co.uk | Buy on Amazon.com

2. The 10,000 Doors of January by Alix E Harrow

Score: 199

Our rating: 10.0 | 1 positive reader reviews

In the early 1900s, a young woman embarks on a fantastical journey of self-discovery after finding a mysterious book in this captivating and lyrical debut.In a sprawling mansion filled with peculiar treasures, January Scaller is a curiosity herself. As the ward of the weal [...]

Buy on Amazon.co.uk | Buy on Amazon.com

3. The Weirdstone of Brisingamen by Alan Garner

Score: 195

Our rating: 9.7 | 3 positive reader reviews

When Colin and Susan are pursued by eerie creatures across Alderley Edge, they are saved by the Wizard. He takes them into the caves of Fundindelve, where he watches over the enchanted sleep of one hundred and forty knights. But the heart of the magic that binds them – Firefrost, also known [...]

Buy on Amazon.co.uk | Buy on Amazon.com

4. The Dark is Rising Sequence by Susan Cooper

Score: 191

Our rating: 9.6 | 1 positive reader reviews

On holiday in Cornwall, the three Drew children discover an ancient map in the attic of the house that they are staying in. They know immediately that it is special. It is even more than that -- the key to finding a grail, a source of power to fight the forces of evil known as the Dark. And in se [...]

Buy on Amazon.co.uk | Buy on Amazon.com

Mordant's Need: Book 2

Score: 188

Our rating: 9.5 | 0 positive reader reviews

Aided by the powerful magic of Vagel, the evil Arch-Imager, the merciless armies are marching against the kingdom of Mordant. In its hour of greatest need, two unlikely champions emerge. One is Geraden, whose inability to master the simplest skills of Imagery has made him a laughingstock. The oth [...]

Buy on Amazon.co.uk | Buy on Amazon.com

6. The City and the City by China Mieville

Score: 184

Our rating: 9.2 | 2 positive reader reviews

When the body of a murdered woman is found in the extraordinary, decaying city of Besźel, somewhere at the edge of Europe, it looks like a routine case for Inspector Tyador Borlú of the Extreme Crime Squad. But as he probes, the evidence begins to point to conspiracies far stranger, and m [...]

Buy on Amazon.co.uk | Buy on Amazon.com

7. City of Stairs by Robert Jackson Bennett

The Divine Cities: Book 1

Score: 182

Our rating: 9.2 | 0 positive reader reviews

You've got to be careful when you're chasing a murderer through Bulikov, for the world is not as it should be in that city. When the gods were destroyed and all worship of them banned by the Polis, reality folded; now stairs lead to nowhere, alleyways have become portals to the past, and [...]

Buy on Amazon.co.uk | Buy on Amazon.com

Score: 180

Our rating: 9.0 | 2 positive reader reviews

WHAT IF you could go back in time and change the course of history? WHAT IF the watershed moment you could change was the JFK assassination? 11/22/63, the date that Kennedy was shot - unless... King takes his protagonist Jake Epping, a high school English teacher from Lisbon Falls, Maine, 2011, o [...]

9. Weaveworld by Clive Barker

Score: 180

Our rating: 8.8 | 6 positive reader reviews

Weaveworld is an epic adventure of the imagination. It begins with a carpet in which a world of rapture and enchantment is hiding; a world which comes to life, alerting the dark forces and beginning a desperate battle to preserve the last vestiges of magic which Humankind still has access to. It [...]

Score: 178

Our rating: 9.0 | 0 positive reader reviews

Under the streets of London there's a place most people could never even dream of. A city of monsters and saints, murderers and angels, knights in armour and pale girls in black velvet. This is the city of the people who have fallen between the cracks. Richard Mayhew, a young businessman, is [...]

Our rating: 9.0 | 0 positive reader reviews

He calls himself Alif - few people know his real name - a young man born in a Middle Eastern city that straddles the ancient and modern worlds. When Alif meets the aristocratic Intisar, he believes he has found love. But their relationship has no future - Intisar is promised to another man and he [...]

Strange dog-like creatures are sent, by one of [...]

Score: 164

Our rating: 8.3 | 0 positive reader reviews

When Charles Wallace Murry goes searching through a 'wrinkle in time' for his lost father, he finds himself on an evil planet where all life is enslaved by a huge pulsating brain known as 'It'. How Charles, his sister Meg and friend Calvin find and free his father makes this a ver [...]

Fractured Fables #1

Score: 158

It's Zinnia Gray's twenty-first birthday, which is extra-special because it's the last birthday she'll ever have. When she was young, an industrial accident left Zinnia with a rare condition. Not much is known about her illness, just that no-one has lived past twenty-one. [...]

A Darker Shade of Magic #1

Score: 120

Our rating: 6.0 | 0 positive reader reviews

Most people only know one London; but what if there were several? Kell is one of the last Travelers - magicians with a rare ability to travel between parallel Londons. There’s Grey London, dirty and crowded and without magic, home to the mad king George III. There’s Red London, where [...]

Score: 105
